description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Resume Extensible Firmware Interface (EFI) security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-37976):

1. Apply the relevant KB updates based on your Windows version from the official Microsoft Update Catalog.

   - Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

2. Ensure that you restart your system after installation to apply the changes.

**Details**:
- The updates address the integer overflow vulnerability impacting the Windows resume feature.
- Important to ensure your system is updated to the respective Windows version to receive the appropriate patch.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with any updates.

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm your Windows version and architecture (x64 or 32-bit) to select the correct KB.
